materials: Bernat® Super Value™ (7 oz/197 g; 426 yds/389 m)
Contrast A Baby Pink (07438) 1 ball
Contrast B Soft Grey (53046) 1 ball
Contrast C Bright Yellow (00608) 1 ball
Contrast D Oatmeal (53010) 1 ball
Contrast E Black (07421) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
1 button.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Scfl = Single crochet in front loop only
measurements: Approx 11" [28 cm] long x 3"  [7.5 cm] wide.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: To join colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color, yoh with new color and proceed.
Back
**With A, ch 11.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 10 sc.
2nd to 6th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Break A, join B at end of last row.
7th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. Scfl in each sc to end of row. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
10th row: Ch 1. Scfl in each sc to end of row. Break B, join C.
11th to 28th rows: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.**
Break C, join D.
29th row: With D, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
30th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 8 sts.
31st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
32nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 6 sts.
33rd row: As 31st row.
34th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Break D, join E. Turn. 4 sts.
35th row: With E, as 31st row.
36th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn. 2 sts.
37th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of 2 sts. Turn.
Make button loop: Ch 6. Skip 1st sc. Join with sl st to last sc. Fasten off.
Front
Work from ** to ** as given for Back. Fasten off at end of 28th row.
Assembly
With WS of Front and Back tog, align bottom edges. Working through both thicknesses, join edges with sl st, changing color as needed to match Pencil colors. Sew button to front to correspond with button loop.

materials: Aunt Lydia™ Fashion 3 (150 yds/137 m) Contrast A Warm Rose (182.0775) 1 ball
Contrast B Maize (182.0423) 1 ball
Contrast C Lime (182.0264) 1 ball
Small Hook: Size U.S. F [3.75 mm] crochet hook
Medium Hook: Size U.S. G [4 mm] crochet hook
Large Hook: Size U.S. H [5 mm] crochet hook, or size needed to obtain gauges.
Yarn needle
abbreviations: Long sc = Single crochet in stitch 2 rows below
measurements: Case: Approx 6½” x 9” [16.5 x 23 cm], unfolded and excluding tie. Hook, Cutter, Needle Pouch: Approx 2” x 5” [5 x 12.5 cm]. Handle Holder: Approx 1” x 2” [2.5 x 5 cm]
gauge: 25 sc and 27 rows = 4” [10 cm] with U.S. F/5 [3.75 mm] crochet hook. 20 sc and 22 rows = 4” [10 cm] with U.S. G/6 [4 mm] crochet hook
instructions:
Main Piece 
With U.S. G/6 [4 mm] crochet hook and 2 strands each of B and C, chain (ch) 43.
1st row: [Right side. (RS)].1 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 42 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Repeat (Rep) last row 32 times more. Fasten oﬀ .
Hook, Cutter, Needle Pouch 
(Make 1)
With U.S. F/5 [3.75 mm] crochet hook and A, ch 31.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 30 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row 7 times more.
Next row: [Wrong side (WS)]. Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 25 sc. Turn. Leave remaining (rem) sts unworked.
Next 3 rows: Ch 1. 1 sch in each sc to end of row. Turn. 25 sc.
Next row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Turn. Leave remaining (rem) sts unworked.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. 5 sc. Fasten oﬀ .
Border around Main Piece
With U.S F/5 [3.75 mm] crochet hook, join A with slip stitch (sl st) to any corner of Main piece.
1st round (rnd): Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *(Work 2 sc. 1 long sc) spaced evenly. Rep from * around, working 2 sc in corners. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten oﬀ .
Tie
With U.S. H/8 [5 mm] crochet hook and 3 strands each of A, B and C, ch 50. 
Join with sl st to middle of right edge of Main Piece.
FINISHING
Pin all pieces to measurements. Cover with a damp cloth leaving cloth to dry.
Following Diagram, sew on all pieces. With B run stitch through Hook Pouch to divide for Hook, Cutter and Needle compartments. With B, run stitch across sides and bottom of Hook, Cutter and Needle Pouch as embellishment.

pattern_name: SANTA AND REINDEER CROCHET BOTTLE TOPPERS
materials: Bernat® Super Value™ (7 oz/197 g; 440 yds/402 m)
Main Color (MC) Cherry Red (53436) 1 ball
Contrast A Oatmeal (53010) 1 ball
Contrast B Natural (07414) 1 ball
Main Color (MC) Chocolate (53013) 1 ball
Contrast A Cherry Red (53436) 1 ball
Contrast B Oatmeal (53010) 1 ball
Contrast C Natural (07414) 1 ball
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge
Black embroidery floss
Yarn needle
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Santa: Approx 5" [12.5 cm] tall, including pompom; Reindeer: Approx 4" [10 cm] tall, excluding antlers
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Note: When joining new color, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed.
SANTA VERSION
**With MC and larger hook, ch 18. Join with sl st to first ch to make a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd 4 times more, joining A at end of last rnd.**
With A, rep 2nd rnd 3 times more. Join MC at end of last rnd.
Next rnd: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sts rem.
Next 2 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 6 sts rem.
Next 2 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 3 sts rem. Fasten off.
Beard
With B and larger hook, ch 5.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 4 sc.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 10 sc at end of 4th row.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
6th and 7th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. Fasten off at end of 7th row.
With RS facing, skip next 6 unworked sc. Join B with sl st in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Next 2 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. Fasten off at end of last row.
Pompom: Wind B around 2 fingers approx 15 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. Attach pom-pom to top of Hat.
FINISHING
Attach Beard to Body as shown in picture. With black embroidery floss, embroider eyes on face using French knots.
REINDEER VERSION
With MC and larger hook, work from ** to ** as given for Santa, omitting reference to color change.
Next rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 22 c.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sc. With A, (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. Yoh and draw through 4 loops on hook – bobble nose made. With MC, 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next 5 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off at end of last rnd, leaving a long end.
Sew top of Reindeer closed.
Antlers (make 2)
With B and smaller hook, ch 12.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. *Ch 4. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch of foundation ch. Rep from * once more. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Fasten off.
Eyes (make 2).
With C and smaller hook, ch 2. 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Scarf
With A and smaller hook, ch 45.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Attach Antlers to top of Reindeer head. Sew eyes to front of head. With black embroidery floss embroider eyes. Tie Scarf around neck.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Small Version Jute (00082) 1 ball or 25 yds/23 m
Medium Version Sage Green (00084) 1 ball or 40 yds/36.5 m
Large Version Indigo (01114) 1 ball or 72 yds/65.5 m
Size F/5 (3.75 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Dcl = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times in indicated stitch or space. Yoh and draw through 4 loops on hook.
measurements: Small Version - To fit 250 ml wide mouth mason jar. Medium Version - To fit 500 ml standard mouth mason jar. Large Version - To fit 1 L standard mouth mason jar.
gauge: 16 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
All Versions: Base
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each st. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sts.
Small Version
Work Base to end of 5th rnd. 30 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. **Proceed in Body Pat as follows:
1st rnd: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). *Skip next st. 1 dc in next st. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sts.


3rd rnd: Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch 2). *Skip next 2 sts. 1 sc in next st. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sts. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc – V st made) in next st. Ch 2. Rep from * to last 5 sts. Skip next 2 sts. 1 sc in next st. Ch 2. Skip last 2 sts. (1 dc. Ch 2) in same sp as beg ch (counts as V-st). Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 5.
4th rnd: Ch 3. *(Dcl. Ch 1) 3 times in ch-2 sp on next V-st. Rep from * to last V-st. [(Dcl. Ch1) twice in ch-2 sp of last V-st. In same sp: (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 30 sts.**
5th and 6th rnds: As 1st and 2nd rnds.
7th rnd: As 2nd rnd. Fasten off.
Medium Version
Work Base to end of 5th rnd. 30 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep from ** to ** as given for Small Version.
5th to 8th rnds: Rep 1st to 4th rnds of Body Pat once more.
9th and 10th rnds: Rep 1st and 2nd rnds of Body Pat.
11th rnd: As 2nd rnd. Fasten off.
Large Version
Work Base to end of 5th rnd. 30 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 42 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep from ** to ** as given for Small Version over 42 sts.
5th to 12th rnds: Rep 1st to 4th rnds of Body Pat twice more. 42 sts.
13th rnd: As 1st rnd.
Without breaking yarn, place jar inside Cozy.
14th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Skip next st. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in each of last 2 sts. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
15th and 16th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 3251 Flame A and 312 Black B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Cover to fit quart size Mason jar
gauge: 17 sc = 4" [10 cm]; 17 rows = 4" [10 cm] in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: redheart.com
©2017 Coats & Clark Page 1 of 1
Working sideways, ch 25 with A.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 24 sc.
Rows 2-5: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 6 (Right Side): Ch 1, turn, working in back loops only, [sc in next sc, sc2tog over next 2 sc] 8 times – 16 sts.
Row 7: Ch 1, turn, working in front loops only, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times – 24 sc.
Rows 8-11: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 12: Repeat Row 6.
Row 13: Repeat Row 7.
Rows 14-55: Repeat Rows 8-13.
Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.
Sew side seams together for back seam.
FINISHING
With right side facing, join A with a slip st in seam at lower edge, working along side edges of rows, [sc in next 4 rows, sc2tog over next 2 rows] across. Fasten off.
Embroidery
Note: It may be easier to work embroidery while Cover is on the jar. Refer to photo for placements.
Use a double strand of B and work horizontal satin stitches to embroider mouth. Add smile lines with straight stitches. Use horizontal satin stitches to embroider eyebrows and nose. Work vertical satin stitches to embroider eyes. Work a line of backstitches around each eye. Use A and satin stitch to embroider tooth on mouth.
Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Paddy Green (0368)
Contrast B Soft White (0316)
Contrast C Perfect Pink (0706)
1 ball
1 ball
Small amount
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: To fit universal-size or wide mouth mason jar lid: 2¾-3 3/8" [7-8.5 cm] diameter
gauge: 13 hdc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Notes: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc. Join all rnds with sl st to first hdc.
HAT 
With A, ch 3. Join with sl st to form a ring. 
1st rnd:  Ch 2. 6 hdc in ring. Join. 6 hdc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * once more. Join. 9 hdc. 
4th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 
5th rnd:  Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * once more. Join. 12 hdc. 
6th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 
7th rnd:  Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of the next 3 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * once more. Join. 15 hdc. 
8th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 
9th rnd:  Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * once more. Join. 18 hdc. 
10th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 
11th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * once more. Join. 21 hdc. 
12th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 
13th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. Rep from * once more. Join. 24 hdc. 
14th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 
15th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. Rep from * once more. Join. 27 hdc. 
16th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 
17th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. Rep from * once more. Join. 30 hdc. 
18th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 
19th rnd:  Ch 2. Working in front loops only, 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc. Rep from * once more. Join. 33 hdc. 
20th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. Fasten off. 
BEARD 
Join B with sl st to any back loop of 19th rnd of Hat. 
1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in back loop of each hdc around. Join. 33 hdc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 10 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 10 hdc. Rep from * once more. Join. 36 hdc. 
3rd rnd: *Ch 10. Sl st in next hdc. Rep from * around. Fasten off.
NOSE 
With C, ch 3. Join with sl st to form a ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc. 1 dc. 2 sc. 1 dc) into ring. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end. 
FINISHING 
Sew Nose to Beard just below Hat. Place lid cover on top of jar.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Cherry Red (0319)
Contrast B Buff (0334)
Contrast C Soft White (0316)
Contrast D Black (0312)
1 ball
1 ball
1 ball
Small amount
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 8" [20.5 cm] high. Fits one-quart Mason jar.
gauge: 15 sc and 18 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.

SANTA
Beg at top of Head, with A, ch 37.
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 36 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 42 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row 7 times more. Join B. With B, rep last row 14 times more. Fasten off, leaving a long end.

HAT CUFF
Note: Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc. With C, ch 44.
1st row: (WS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 42 dc.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Fasten off, leaving long end.

HAT TOP
With A, ch 2. 1st row: (WS). 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 6 sc.
2nd and alt rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 12 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 18 sc.
7th row: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next 2 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 24 sc.
9th row: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next 3 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 30 sc.
10th to 16th rows: As 2nd row. Fasten off, leaving a long end.
Pompom: Wind C around 3 fingers 60 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape.

NOSE
With B, ch 2. 1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end.

BEARD CURLS (make 17)
With C, ch 8. 1st row: (RS). 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. 21 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end.

FINISHING
Sew Hat Cuff to Santa as shown in picture. Sew back seam. With D, embroider eyes using Satin stitch. Sew Hat Top side seam. Sew top opening closed. Sew pompom securely to tip of Hat Top. Sew to Santa as shown in picture. Sew Nose and Beard Curls in place as shown in picture. Satin Stitch

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds /109 m)
Main Color (MC) Hot Blue (01742) 1 ball or 57 yds/52 m
Contrast A Red (00095)  1 ball or 12 yds/11 m
Contrast B White (00001) 1 ball or 77 yds/70 m
Contrast C Hot Green (01712)  1 ball or 37 yds/34 m
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Length of ribbon 18" [45.5 cm] long.
Sewing needle and thread in coordinating shade.
measurements: Approx 12" x 6½" [30.5 x16.5 cm].
gauge: 16 sc and 19 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Stripe Pat
With MC, work 1 row.
With B, work 1 row.
With MC, work 1 row.
With A, work 2 rows.
With C, work 1 row.
With A, work 2 rows.
With MC, work 1 row.
With B, work 1 row.
With MC, work 4 rows.
These 14 rows form Stripe Pat.
With A, ch 49.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
1 sc in each ch to end of ch. 48 sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures approx 3½" [9 cm], ending on a RS row and joining MC at end of last row. Break A.
Next row: (Fold row). (WS). With MC, ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Proceed in Stripe Pat as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Working in both loops, *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. (1 sc in next sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc) twice. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * once more. Join B. Break MC. Turn.
2nd row: With B, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc) twice. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * once more. Turn.
First 2 rows of Stripe Pat complete.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last 2 rows until 14 rows of Stripe Pat have been competed twice. Fasten off.
Vertical Stripes
Stripe 1: With RS facing, join C with sl st to unworked back loop only of 4th sc of Fold row. Ch 28. Fasten off.
Pocket divisions: With sewing thread, sew through all thicknesses from bottom to top of Pocket 4 sts in from side edge of work. Rep stitching at 4 st intervals along entire width of Pocket.
Tie: Mark length of ribbon approx 6" [15 cm] from one end. Sew ribbon at marker to outer end of Caddy as shown in photo, leaving long end of ribbon to wrap around Caddy.
Weave ch through ch-1 sps, working over and under ch. Tie end of ch to last row to secure.
Stripe 2: Join A with sl st to unworked back loop only of 15th sc of Fold row. Work as for Stripe 1.
Stripe 3: Join C with sl st to unworked back loop only of 17th sc of Fold row. Work as for Stripe 1.
Stripe 4: Join A with sl st to unworked back loop only of 19th sc of Fold row. Work as for Stripe 1.
Stripe 5: Join C with sl st to unworked back loop only of 28th sc of Fold row. Work as for Stripe 1.
Stripe 6: Join A with sl st to unworked back loop only of 39th sc of Fold row. Work as for Stripe 1.
Stripe 7: Join C with sl st to unworked back loop only of 41st sc of Fold row. Work as for Stripe 1.
Stripe 8: Join A with sl st to unworked back loop only of 43rd sc of Fold row. Work as for Stripe 1.
FINISHING
Edging: With WS facing, fold work at Fold row to form pocket. With RS facing, join B with sl st to top right corner of Caddy.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 1 rnd sc, working through both thicknesses where necessary, in rem back loops only along fold and working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Patons Classic Wool (100 g / 3.5 oz) #00207 (Rich Red): 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension.
measurements: Approx 5 x 10 ins [12.5 x 25.5 cm].
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions: Ch 26. 1st row:(RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 25 sc. 2nd row:Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until work from beg measures 22 ins [56 cm], ending with a WS row. Fasten off. FINISHING Felt piece following “How to Felt” instructions. Shape pieces to measurements. Dry flat away from heat and direct sunlight. Trim piece if necessary to measurements 5 x 20 ins [12.5 x 51 cm]. IMPORTANT TO KNOW BEFORE FELTING Record all the measurements and changes before and after felting. You will be able to adjust the method to produce proper results. Always test a sample. Different colored yarns may felt differently. Colorfastness can be affected by very hot water. Any crochet that has been properly felted becomes very dense and matted. HOW TO FELT Using low water level, run a Hot/Cold cycle for 5 to 15 min. Add a pair of old jeans for agitation. Add 2 tablespoons of baking soda for a small load. After one cycle, check for size. Repeat if necessary. Run through the rinse and dry spin cycle. Do not use a clothes dryer. Lay felted piece onto a dry towel, away from direct heat or sunlight. Shape piece to correct measurements. If an edge ripples, baste a thread through the edge and gather in. Remove the thread after the felting is dry. Fold bottom 4 ins [10 cm] to RS to form pocket and top 6 ins [15 cm] to WS of piece (see Diagram). Blanket st through both thicknesses along sides of piece. Trace a 2½ ins [6 cm] diameter circle 1 ½ ins [4 cm] down from top fold and carefully cut it out. Blanket st around “hole”.

materials: 1 skein each 368 Paddy Green A
316 Soft White B
235 Lemon C
319 Cherry Red D
706 Perfect Pink E
520 Minty F
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
Jar
abbreviations: A, B, C, D, E, F = Colors A, B, C, D, E, F
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Finished tree is 7" (17.75 cm) wide and 10" (25.5 cm) tall, including star. To fit universal-size mason jar lid: 2¾“ (70mm) diameter. To fit wide-mouth mason jar: 3⅜” (86mm) diameter.
gauge: 12 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 7 rows = 4” [10 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
TREE BASE
Note: To substitute the adjustable ring, ch 3 and join to first ch.
With A, make an adjustable ring as follows: Wrap yarn around your finger with the yarn tail to the left and under the working yarn. Insert hook through the circle from front to back. Yarn over using the working yarn and pull through loop.
Round 1: Ch 1, 6 sc in adjustable ring, join to first sc. Pull starting end tight to close the circle – 6 sc.
Rounds 2 & 3: Sc in each of next 6 sts. 
Round 4: Working in back loops only, (hdc, dc) in next st, 1 dc in next st, *2 dc in next st, 1 dc in next st; repeat from * once more – 9 sts.
Round 5: Working in back loops only, *2 dc in next st, 1 dc in each of next 2 sts; repeat from * 2 more times – 12 dc. 
Round 6: Working in back loops only, *2 dc in next st, 1 dc in each of next 3 sts; repeat from * 2 more times – 15 dc. 
Round 7: Working in back loops only, *2 dc in next st, 1 dc in each of next 4 sts; repeat from * 2 more times – 18 dc. 
Round 8: Working in back loops only, *2 dc in next st, 1 dc in each of next 5 sts; repeat from * 2 more times – 21 dc. 
Round 9: Working in back loops only, *2 dc in next st, 1 dc in each of next 6 sts; repeat from * 2 more times – 24 dc. 
Round 10: Working in back loops only, *2 dc in next st, 1 dc in each of next 7 sts; repeat from * 2 more times – 27 dc.
Round 11: Working in back loops only, *2 dc in next st, 1 dc in each of next 8 sts; repeat from * 2 more times – 30 dc.
Round 12: Working in back loops only, *2 dc in next st, 1 dc in each of next 9 sts; repeat from * 2 more times – 33 dc.
Round 13: Working in back loops only, *2 dc in next st, 1 dc in each of next 10 sts; repeat from * 2 more times – 36 dc.
Round 14: Working in back loops only, *2 dc in next st, 1 dc in each of next 11 sts; repeat from * 2 more times – 39 dc.
Round 15: Working in back loops only, *2 dc in next st, 1 dc in each of next 12 sts; repeat from * 2 more times – 42 dc.
Round 16: Working in back loops only, *2 dc in next st, 1 dc in each of next 13 sts; repeat from * 2 more times, 1 hdc in next st, 1 sc in next st, slip st in next st – 48 sts.
Do not fasten off.
OUTER LAYER OF TREE
Note: You will now be working into all the front loops left behind.
Round 1: Turn, *ch 3, skip 2 sts, slip st into next front loop; repeat from * around.
Repeat this round until you have reached the top of the tree and worked the last front loop.
Next round: Turn, 3 sc in first ch space, sc into slip st, *(2 dc, Picot Stitch, 2 dc) in next ch space, sc in next slip st; repeat from * around.
Repeat this round until you have reached the bottom of the tree; sc in st after the last ch space.
Fasten off.
STAR TREE TOPPER (Make 2)
With C, make an adjustable ring. 
Round 1: Ch 1, 5 sc in adjustable ring, join to first sc. Pull starting end tight to close the circle – 5 sc.
Round 2: *Ch 3, turn; skip 1 ch, 1 sc in each of next 2 ch, slip st into next sc; repeat from * 4 more times.
Fasten off, leaving a 24” (61 cm) tail. 
GARLAND
With B, ch 200. 
Row 1: Slip st into 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 199 slip sts.
Fasten off, leaving a 60” (152.5 cm) tail.
CHRISTMAS ORNAMENTS (Make 3 each using C, D, E, and F)
Make an adjustable ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 6 sc in adjustable ring, join to first sc. Pull starting end tight to close the circle.
Fasten off, leaving a 12” (30.5 cm) tail. 
FINISHING
With yarn needle and long tail, join the front and back of the star together and attach to the top of tree.
Using long yarn tail, attach garland around tree, sliding the needle and yarn through the garland between branches.
Using long yarn tails, attach ornaments to tree.
Weave in all loose ends. Place the lid cover on top of the jar.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball each 9388 Wheat A, 4614 Black B, 9518 Teal C, and 9523 Dark Leaf D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
Stitch marker
¾” (19 mm) or 1” (25 mm) button
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Case measures 7” wide x 4” long (18 x 10 cm).
gauge: 15 sc = 4” (10 cm); 15 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
CASE
With A, ch 27.
Round 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across to last ch, 2 sc in last ch; working in opposite side of foundation ch, skip first ch, sc in next 25 ch; join with slip st in first sc—52 sc.
Rounds 2 and 3: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 4: Repeat Round 2; change to B.
Round 5: Ch 1, spike st in first st, sc in next st, *spike st in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 6: Repeat Round 2; change to C.
Round 7: Repeat Round 5.
Round 8: Repeat Round 2; change to D.
Round 9: Repeat Round 5.
Round 10: Repeat Round 2; change to A.
Round 11: Repeat Round 5.
Rounds 12–14: Repeat Round 2.
Flatten case and place st marker in center st on back edge for buttonhole.
Round 15: Ch 1, sc in each st around to marked st, ch 15 (buttonhole made), sc in marked st, sc in each remaining st around; join with slip st in first sc—52 sc and 1 buttonhole.
Round 16: Slip st in each sc and ch around; join with slip st in first slip st. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With A, sew button to center front of case below top edge.
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat ® Super Value (197 g/7 oz; 389 m/426 yds)
Quit Smoking Version Main Color (MC) (07391 White) 1 ball
Contrast A (00607 Berry) 1 ball
Quit Swearing Version Main Color (MC) (00607 Berry) 1 ball
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Quit Smoking Version: Small amount of 07421 (Black) as B Glue.
Quit Swearing Version: Small amount of 07421 (Black) as B for embroidery.
measurements: To fit standard 1 quart [1 litre] canning jar.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4 ins [10 cm]
instructions:
Cozy (both versions alike) 
With MC, ch 12. Join with sl st to form ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 24 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 42 sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with B with sl st to first sc. 48 sc. 
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 54 sc. 
7th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
8th rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd until work from 7th rnd measures 7 ins [18 cm]. 
Fasten off. 
Quit Smoking Version: “No Smoking” Sign 
With MC, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc. 
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc. 
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 56 sc. 
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with A with sl st to first sc. 64 sc. 
9th rnd: With A, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next sc. *1 dc in each of next 3 sc. 2 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 dc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.
Finishing
Quit Smoking Version 
Glue Cigarette to Sign. Cut 2 lengths of B to same height as Cigarette and glue to Sign as seen in picture. Cut 2 more lengths of B 1 inch [2.5 cm] and 2 ½ ins [6 cm] and glue to Sign in smoke format as seen in picture. Sew Strike Bar to Sign as seen in picture. 
Quit Swearing Version 
With black yarn, embroider symbols with outline stitch as in diagram.

materials: Lily® Sugar 'n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Red (00095) 1 ball or 57 yds/52 m
Contrast B Jute (00082) 1 ball or 46 yds/42 m
Contrast C Soft Ecru (01004) 1 ball or 75 yds/68 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
Small amount of Black worsted weight yarn or embroidery floss for eyes.
measurements: Approx 8" [20.5 cm] high. Fits one-quart Mason jar.
gauge: 15 sc and 18 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
SANTA
Beg at top of Head, with A, ch 37. See diagram on page 3.
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 36 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 42 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row 7 times more. Join B. With B, rep last row 14 times more. 
Fasten off, leaving a long end.
HAT CUFF
Note: Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc. 
With C, ch 44.
1st row: (WS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 42 dc.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Fasten off, leaving long end.
HAT TOP
With A, ch 2. See diagram on page 3.
1st row: (WS). 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 6 sc.
2nd and alt rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 12 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 18 sc.
7th row: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next 2 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 24 sc.
9th row: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next 3 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 30 sc.
10th to 16th rows: As 2nd row. Fasten off, leaving a long end.
Pompom: Wind C around 3 fingers 60 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Hat. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape.
NOSE
With B, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end.
BEARD CURLS (make 17)
With C, ch 8.
1st row: (RS). 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. 21 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end. 
FINISHING
Sew Hat Cuff to Santa as shown in picture. Sew back seam.
With black yarn or embroidery floss, embroider eyes using Satin stitch. Sew Hat Top side seam. Sew top opening closed. Sew pompom securely to tip of Hat Top. Sew to Santa as shown in picture.
Sew Nose and Beard Curls in place as shown in picture.

pattern_name: Long Weekend BBQ Mason Jar Crochet Cozies
materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Red (00095) or White (00001) or Dazzle Blue (01131) 1 ball or 39 yds/35 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: To fit 500 ml regular mouth Mason jar with 2¾" [7 cm] diameter opening.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st. 
• Ch 3 at beg of rnds counts as dc.
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 7 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 7 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 14 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 21 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 28 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 35 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
8th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 sc. (Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. 1 dc in each of next 4 sc) 5 times. Ch 2. Skip next sc. Join. 24 dc and 6 ch-2 sps.
9th rnd: Ch 5 (counts as dc, ch 2). Skip next 2 dc. (1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc) 5 times. 1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in last ch-2 sp. Join to 3rd ch of beg ch-5.
10th rnd: Ch 3. (2 dc in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in next dc) 5 times. 2 dc in last ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. Join.
11th rnd: As 9th rnd.
12th rnd: As 10th rnd.
13th rnd: As 9th rnd.
14th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. (2 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next dc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next dc) 5 times. 2 sc in last ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next dc. Sc2tog. Join. 30 sc. 
15th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 5 times. (Sc2tog) twice. Join. 23 sc.
Fasten off.

materials: 1 skein each 316 Soft White A and 312 Black B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6]
Small amount of fiberfill, stitch markers, yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Cozy to fit quart size Mason jar
gauge: 17 sc = 4" [10 cm]; 17 rows = 4" [10 cm] in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Beginning at top of head, ch 37 with A. 
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across – 36 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, [sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 42 sc.
Rows 3-21: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 22: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), turn, dc in next 5 sc, 2 dc in next sc, [dc in next 6 sc, 2 dc in next sc] 5 times – 48 dc.
Row 23: Ch 1, turn, [sc in next st, skip next st, 5 dc next st, sk next st] 11 times, sc in next st skip next st, 5 dc in next st, sc in last st. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing. 
Sew side seams together for back seam.

ARM (make 2)
Note: Arm is worked in continuous rounds. 
With A, ch 2. 
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Place marker for beginning of round. 
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around – 12 sc. 
Rounds 3-5: Sc in each sc around. 
Round 6: (Sc in next sc, ch 3, work 4 dc in same sc, remove hook and put it through top of ch-3, draw loop of last dc through) all in same st for thumb, sc in remaining 11 sc.
Round 7: Skip thumb, sc in next 11 sc. 
Rounds 8-11: Sc in each sc around. 
Fasten off, leaving long end for sewing. 
Stuff hand section, do not stuff arm. 

FINISHING
Flatten last round of each arm and sew one arm on either side of Cozy.

Embroidery
Note: It may be easier to work embroidery while Cozy is on the jar. 
Refer to photo for placements.
Use a double strand of B and satin stitch to embroider mouth. Use satin stitch to embroider two eyes. 
Weave in ends.

materials: 1 skein each Minty 520 A and Mushroom 369 B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle
universal-size jar with lid
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: To fit universal-size jar lid: 2¾“ (70mm) diameter
gauge: 16 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 12 rows = 4” [10 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
JAR LID COVER
With A, make an adjustable ring as follows: Wrap yarn around your finger with the yarn tail to the left and under the working yarn. Insert hook through the circle from front to back. Yarn over using the working yarn and pull through loop.
Round 1: Ch 1, 8 hdc in adjustable ring; join to first hdc, pull yarn tail tightly to close the ring – 8 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 1 (does not count as st here and throughout), 2 hdc in each of the next 8 hdc; join to first hdc – 16 hdc.
Round 3: Ch 1, 2 hdc in first st, 1 hdc in next st, *2 hdc in next st, 1 hdc in next st; repeat from * 6 more times, join to first hdc – 24 hdc.
Round 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each of the next 2 sts, *2 sc in next st, 1 sc in each of the next 2 sts; repeat from * 6 more times, join to first sc – 32 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in the back loop only of each sc; join to first sc – 32 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, hdc in each st around; join to first hdc – 32 hdc.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join to first sc – 32 sc.
Round 8: Slip st in each st around. Fasten off.
DOG BONE (make 2)
Round 1: With B, ch 9, 3 hdc in second ch from hook, 1 sc in each of next 6 ch, 3 hdc in last ch; rotate piece to work up the other side of the ch, 1 sc in each of next 6 ch; join to first hdc – 6 hdc, 12 sc.
Round 2: Ch 2, 3 tr in first st, sc in next st, 3 tr in next st, ch 2, slip st into same st, slip st into next 7 sts, ch 2, 3 tr in same st, sc in next st, 3 tr in next st, ch 2, slip st into same st, slip st into last 5 sts – 12 tr, 2 sc, 6 ch, 14 slip sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail on one side of the bone for seaming later.
FINISHING
With yarn needle and long tail, seam the front and back of the bone together. Join the bottom of the dog bone to the top of the lid cover. Weave in all loose ends. Place the lid cover on top of the jar.

materials: Lily® Sugar'n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Main Color (MC) Red (00095) 1 ball or 13 yds/12 m
Contrast A Jute (00082) 1 ball or 5 yds/4 m
Contrast B White (00001) 1 ball or 7 yds/5 m
Main Color (MC) Warm Brown (01130) 1 ball or 20 yds/18 m
Contrast A Red (00095) 1 ball or 7 yds/6 m
Contrast A Jute (00082) 1 ball or 7 yds/6 m
Contrast B White (00001) 1 ball or 1 yd/1 m
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge
Black embroidery floss
Susan Bates® yarn needle
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Santa: Approx 5" [12.5 cm] tall, including pompom. Reindeer: Approx 4" [10 cm] tall, excluding antlers.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Note: When joining new color, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed.
SANTA VERSION
**With MC and larger hook, ch 18. Join with sl st to first ch to make a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd 4 times more, joining A at end of last rnd.**
With A, rep 2nd rnd 3 times more. Join MC at end of last rnd.
Next rnd: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sts rem. Next 2 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 6 sts rem.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 3 sts rem. Fasten off.
Beard
With B and larger hook, ch 5.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 4 sc.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 10 sc at end of 4th row.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 6th and 7th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. Fasten off at end of 7th row.
With RS facing, skip next 6 unworked sc. Join B with sl st in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Next 2 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. Fasten off at end of last row.
Pompom: Wind B around 2 fingers approx 15 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. Attach pom-pom to top of Hat.
FINISHING
Attach Beard to Body as shown in picture. With black embroidery floss, embroider eyes on face using French knots.
REINDEER VERSION
With MC and larger hook, work from ** to ** as given for Santa, omitting reference to color change.
Next rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sc. Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 22 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sc. With A, (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times in next st. Yoh and draw through 4 loops on hook – bobble nose made. With MC, 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next 5 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off at end of last rnd, leaving a long end. Sew top of Reindeer closed.
Antlers (make 2)
With B and smaller hook, ch 12. 1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. *Ch 4. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch of foundation ch. Rep from * once more. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Fasten off.
Eyes (make 2).
With C and smaller hook, ch 2. 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Scarf
With A and smaller hook, ch 45. 1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Attach Antlers to top of Reindeer head. Sew eyes to front of head. With black embroidery floss embroider eyes. Tie Scarf around neck.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Baker’s Cotton: 1 ball 900 Red or 700 Pink
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 3.5mm [US E-4]
2” (5 cm) foam ball for Small jar cover
21⁄2” (6.5 cm) foam ball for Large jar cover
two 6” (15 cm) felt squares in white or color to match yarn
white glue
straight pins
yarn needle
1⁄2” (12.7 mm) or 5⁄8” (15.9 mm) button (optional)
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Pin Cushion fits lid of Small 16-oz pint Mason jar or Large 32-oz wide-mouth quart Mason jar.
gauge: 21 sc = 4” (10 cm); 26 rows sc = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needles/hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions: Round 12: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 5 sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 3 sc] 9 times; slip st in first sc to join—52 sc. Fasten off and weave in ends. Cushion Side for size Large: Continue working into last Round of Top. Rounds 9-12: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; slip st in first sc to join—48 sc. Round 13: Ch 2 (counts as a hdc), hdc in same st as joining, hdc in each of next 3 sc, [2 hdc in next sc, hdc in each of next 3 sc] 11 times; slip st in top of beginning ch-2 to join—60 hdc. Fasten off and weave in ends. Lid Side Band (Instructions for size Large are in parentheses): Ch 60 (72); being careful not to twist, join with a slip st to form a ring. Round 1: Ch 2 (counts as a hdc), hdc in each ch around; slip st in top of beginning ch-2 to join—60 (72) hdc. Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as hdc and ch-1), [skip next hdc, hdc in next hdc, ch 1] around until 1 hdc remains, skip last hdc; slip st in 2nd ch of beginning ch-3 to join—30 (36) hdc and 30 (36) ch-1 spaces. Round 3: Ch 2, hdc in each hdc and ch-1 space around; slip st in top of beginning ch-2 to join—60 (72) hdc. Fasten off and weave in ends. Flower: Ch 4, join with a slip st to form a ring. Round 1 (Right side): Ch 2 (counts as a hdc), 11 hdc in ring; slip st in top of beginning ch-2 to join—12 hdc. Round 2: Ch 2, dc in same st as joining, (tr, dc) in next hdc, ch 2, [(slip st, ch 2, dc) in next hdc, (tr, dc) in next hdc, ch 2] 5 times; join with slip st in base of beginning ch-2—6 petals. Fasten off and weave in ends. Assembly: 1. Carefully cut the foam ball in half. 2. Slightly stretch a felt square to cover the top of the ball (you may need to cut a few slits in order to keep it smooth). Fold the felt under the ball about ½”. Glue the ends of the felt down, but do not glue the felt on the round part of the ball, as it will make it difficult to pin into. Do not use hot glue, as this can melt the foam. Place a few pins in the ball to hold everything together while it dries. Let it dry upside down so it does not stick to your surface. 3. Cut a piece of felt to cover the bottom cut edge of the ball and glue it on. Place a few pins in the ball to hold everything together while it dries. Let it dry upside down so it does not stick to your surface. 4. Sew a Flower and button on top of the Pin Cushion (optional). 5. Place the felt-covered foam ball half inside the Pin Cushion cover, then glue the bottom of the ball to the top of the Mason jar lid. When the glue is dry, slip the outer piece of the jar lid into place. 6. Cut 5 strands of yarn each 20” (51 cm) long. Thread the strands through Round 2 of the Lid Side Band, referring to photo for placement. Place the Lid Side Band around the outer piece of the jar lid and tie the strands of yarn together, then clip the ends. Slide the tied strings around until the knot is inside the Band, or sew a Flower and button over the knot.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein 629 green tones.
Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8].
Button, ⅜” diameter, yarn needle.
measurements: Finished Measurement: 6” x 7”, folded closed.
gauge: GAUGE: 13 sc = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
HOOK CASE
Flap
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 2, beginning in 2nd ch from hook, work 20 fsc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc between each st across, turn – 20 sc.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 3” from beginning, end with a right side row.
Top Fold Row (Wrong Side): Ch 1, turn, working in front loop only, sc in each st across – 20 sc.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 7” from Top Fold Row, end with a right side row.
Bottom Fold Row (Wrong Side): Ch 1, turn, working in front loop only, sc in each st across – 20 sc.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 5” from Bottom Fold Row, end with a right side row. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Fold bottom to right side along Bottom Fold Row. Working through both layers, work sc to join layers together along one side edge to Bottom Fold Row, working in back loops only, slip st in each st across, work sc to join layers together along opposite side edge. Fasten off. 
With right side facing, join yarn at edge of Flap and work backwards sc around to center of Row 1, ch 21, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across to Flap edge for Tie, work in backwards sc around to opposite edge of Flap. Fasten off.
Weave in ends. Sew button on bottom section opposite Tie. Divide bottom in desired number of pockets and mark. Work running stitches through both layers to secure pockets.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball each 9870 Deep Sea A, 9440 Light Grey Heather B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Fits standard size small and large Mason jars. Small finished circumference: 7” [18 cm], Height: 5” [13 cm]. Large finished circumference: 8” [20 cm], Height: 7” [18 cm].
gauge: 12 dc = 4” [10 cm] and 4 rows = 3” [7.5 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
LARGE COZY
With A, ch 4, slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1 (Right side): Ch 2, 6 dc into ring, slip st into top of ch-2 to join — 7 dc.
Round 2: Ch 2, dc in same st, 2 dc in each of next 5 sts, dc in next st, slip st in top of ch-2 to join — 13 dc.
Round 3: Ch 2, dc in same st, 2 dc in each st around, slip st in top of ch-2 to join — 26 dc.
Round 4: Ch 3 (counts as dc), dc in same st, * skip next st, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around, slip st in top of ch-3 to join — 26 dc.
Rounds 5-12: Repeat Round 4.
Round 13: Ch 2 (counts as sc, ch 1), * sc in next dc, skip next dc, ch 1; repeat from * around, slip st in 1st ch of beginning ch-2 — 14 sc, 14 ch-1 spaces. Fasten off and weave in ends.

SMALL COZY
With B, ch 5, slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1 (Right side): Ch 2, 9 dc into ring, slip st into top of ch-2 to join — 10 dc.
Round 2: Ch 2, dc in same st, 2 dc in each st around, slip st in top of ch-2 to join — 20 dc.
Round 3: Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch-1), *skip next st, dc in next st, ch 1; repeat from * around, slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-4 to join — 10 dc, 10 ch-1 spaces.
Round 4: Ch 3 (counts as dc), dc in same st, 2 dc in each dc around, slip st in top of ch-3 to join — 20 dc.

FINISHING
Block lightly if desired.

pattern_name: Light Up The Love Crochet Jar Cozy
materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Ecru (00004) or Rose Pink (00046) or Hot Pink (01740) or Red (00095) 1 ball or 65.5 yds/60 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: One size to fit 500 ml standard mouth mason jar.
gauge: 13 hdc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc. Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
Jar Cozy 
Ch 2. 
1st rnd: 7 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 7 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 14 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 21 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 28 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 35 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Turn.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Turn.
8th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 17 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 hdc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. Turn.
9th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 16 hdc. Ch 3. Skip next 3 sts. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of rnd. Join. Turn.
10th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 15 hdc. Ch 5. Skip next 5 sts. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of rnd. Join. Turn.
11th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 14 hdc. Ch 7. Skip next 7 sts. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of rnd. Join. Turn.
12th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 13 hdc. Ch 9. Skip next 9 sts. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of rnd. Join. Turn.
13th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 13 hdc. Ch 4. Skip next 4 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. Ch 4. Skip next 4 ch. 1 sc in each hdc to end of rnd. Join. Turn.
14th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 14 sts. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 hdc in each st to end of rnd. Join. Turn.
15th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st around. Join. Turn.
16th rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Holiday: 1 ball 1360 Aran/Gold
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4 mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle
16 oz (545 g) narrow-mouth Mason jar
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Cozy measures 3½” (9 cm) in diameter and 6” (15 cm).
gauge: Rounds 1-6=3½” (9 cm) in diameter. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
COZY
Make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 hdc in each st around; join with slip st in first hdc—12 hdc.
Round 3: Ch 2 (counts here as first dc), dc in same st as join, ch 1, 2 dc in next st, *slip st in next st, (ch 2, dc) in same st, ch 1, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around; join in bottom of beginning ch—12 dc and 6 ch-1 spaces.
Round 4: Slip st in each ch and dc, slip st in first ch-1 space, ch 1, (sc, ch 5) in each ch-1 space around; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc and 6 ch-5 spaces.
Round 5: Ch 1, hdc in first sc, 5 hdc in next ch-5 space, *hdc in next sc, 5 hdc in next ch-5 space; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first hdc—36 hdc.
Round 6: Ch 1, hdc in first 5 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc, *hdc in next 5 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first hdc—42 hdc.
Round 7: Ch 1, working in back loops only, hdc in each hdc around; join with slip st in first hdc.
Round 8: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in next 2 sts, *[ch 3, skip next 2 sts, sc in next st] 3 times, ch 3, skip next 2 sts, dc in next 3 sts; repeat from * once, [ch 3, skip next 2 sts, sc in next st] 3 times, ch 3, skip last 2 sts; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—9 dc and 12 ch-3 spaces.
Round 9: Ch 1, hdc in same st as join, fpdc around next dc, hdc in next dc, *ch 1, sc in next ch-3 space, [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space] 3 times, ch 1, hdc in next dc, fpdc around next dc, hdc in next dc; repeat from * once, ch 1, sc in next ch-3 space, [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space] 3 times, ch 1; join with slip st in first hdc—6 hdc, 3 fpdc, and 9 ch-3 spaces.
Round 10: Ch 3, 2 dc in first st, 3 dc in next 2 sts, *sc in next ch-3 space, [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space] twice, 3 dc in next 3 sts; repeat from * once, sc in next ch-3 space, [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space] twice; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—27 dc and 6 ch-3 spaces.
Round 11: Ch 4 (counts as first dc, ch 1), dc in next dc, (ch 1, dc) in next 7 dc, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, *dc in next dc, (ch 1, dc) in next 8 dc, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch—27 dc, 24 ch-1 spaces, and 3 ch-3 spaces.
Round 12: Ch 1, hdc in first dc, hdc in next ch-1 space, [hdc in next dc, hdc in next ch-1 space] 3 times, fpdc around next st, [hdc in next ch-1 space, hdc in next dc] 4 times, sc in next ch-3 space, *[hdc in next dc, hdc in next ch-1 space] 4 times, fpdc around next st, [hdc in next ch-1 space, hdc in next dc] 4 times, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first hdc—3 sc, 48 hdc, and 3 fpdc.
Round 13: Ch 2 (does not count as a st here and throughout), beginning in same st as join, *dc2tog, [ch 2, dc2tog] 3 times, ch 2, fpdc around next fpdc, [ch 2, dc2tog] 4 times, skip next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first dc—24 dc, 3 fpdc, and 24 ch-2 spaces.
Round 14: Ch 2, beginning in same st as join, *dc3tog, ch 2, dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2, dc3tog, ch 2, fpdc around next fpdc, ch 2, dc3tog, ch 2, dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2, dc3tog, ch 1; repeat from * around; join in first dc—18 dc, 3 fpdc, 3 ch-1 spaces, and 18 ch-2 spaces.
Round 15: Ch 2, beginning in same st as join, *dc2tog, skip next dc, dc2tog, [ch 3, sc in next ch-2 space] twice, ch 3, dc2tog, skip next dc, dc2tog, ch 3, sc in next ch-1 space, ch 3; repeat from * around; join in first dc—12 dc and 15 ch-3 spaces.
Round 16: Ch 2, beginning in same st as join, *dc2tog, [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space] 3 times, ch 3, dc2tog, [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space] twice, ch 3; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first dc—6 dc and 21 ch-3 spaces.
Round 17: Slip st in first ch-3 space, ch 1, sc in same ch-3 space, (ch 3, sc) in each ch-3 space around; ch 3; join with slip st in first sc—21 sc and 21 ch-3 spaces.
Round 18: Work 2 sc in first ch-3 space, slip st in next ch-3 space, ch 1, sc in same ch-3 space, *skip next ch-3 space, fan in next ch-3 space, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next sc, skip next ch-3 space, fan in next ch-3 space, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * once, skip next ch-3 space, fan in next ch-3 space, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next sc, skip next ch-3 space, fan in last space; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc and 6 fans.
Round 19: Slip st in each tr and ch-1 space to center ch-1 space of first fan, slip st in center ch-1 space, ch 3, hdc in 3rd ch from hook (point made), *slip st in each st and ch-1 space to center ch-1 space of next fan, slip st in center ch-1 space, ch 3, hdc in 3rd ch from hook (point made); repeat from * around, slip st in each remaining st and ch-1 space; join with slip st in first slip st—6 points. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Stretch out points.

materials: Lily® Sugar'n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Main Color (MC) Blueberry (01725) 1 ball or 25 m/27 yds
Contrast A Red (00095) 1 ball or 3 m/3 yds
Contrast B Sage Green (00084) 1 ball or 3 m/3 yds
Blackberry Version: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® Scents (2 oz/56.7 g; 95 yds/ 86 m) Main Color (MC) Red (00095) 1 ball or 25 m/27 yds
Contrast A Black Currant (50318) 1 ball or 8 m/9 yds
Contrast B Sage Green (00084) 1 ball or 3 m/3 yds
Orange Slice Version: Main Color (MC) Tangerine (01699) 1 ball or 25 m/27 yds
Contrast A Hot Orange (01628) 1 ball or 8 m/9 yds
Contrast B White (00001) 1 ball or 3 m/3 yds
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Stuffing
measurements: Approx 3" (7.5 cm) in diameter. To fit standard wide mouth canning jar.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Basic Topper (See Chart on page 2). 
With MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Miss next 2 sc. (Ch 1. 1 dc) 4 times in next sc. Ch 1. Miss next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
9th rnd: Ch 5 (counts as 1 dc and ch 2). Miss next 2 ch-1 sps. [(1 dc. Ch 1) twice. 1 dc] in next ch-1 sp. Miss next 2 ch-1 sps. *Ch 2. 1 dc in next sc. Ch 2. Miss next 2 ch-1 sps. [(1 dc. Ch 1) twice. 1 dc] in next ch-1 sp. Miss next 2 ch-1 sps. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 5.
10th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in next dc. *Ch 2. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 sc) in next ch-1 sp. Ch 5. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 sc) in next ch-1 sp. Ch 2. ** 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * around, ending at **. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Strawberry (make 2).
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 4 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc2tog made. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc.
Stuff Strawberry Lightly.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 4 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 4 sc.
Fasten off.
Strawberry Top (make 2).
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: (1 sc. Ch 3. Sl st in 3rd ch from hook) 6 times in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Sew Strawberry Top to Strawberry.
Blackberry (make 2).
Note: Push tr to RS of work.
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: (1 sc. 1 tr) 3 times in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *(1 sc. 1 tr) in next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Stuff Blackberry lightly.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *Draw up a loop in next st. (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop in next st. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times – dec made. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st.
Fasten off.
Blackberry Top (make 2).
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: (1 sc. Ch 2. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook) 5 times in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Sew Blackberry Top to Blackberry.
Orange Slice (make 2).
With MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join B with sl st to first sc. Break MC. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: With B, ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to first sc. Break B. 18 sc.
Fold work in half.
Join A with sl st to sc at fold. Working through both thicknesses, proceed as follows:
4th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 3 times.
Fasten off. With B, embroider ‘segments’ using straight st.
FINISHING (All versions)
Tie: With B, ch 55. Sew one Strawberry, Blackberry, or Orange Slice to each end of Tie. Wrap Tie around Topper.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Sand (10014) 2 balls or 349 yds/319 m
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
Yarn needle.
measurements: Approx 15" x 33½" [38 x 85 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 10 sc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Caddy is worked with tighter gauge than standard gauge for stability.
• Caddy is worked flat in one piece and folded and seamed to form Pocket.
• Pocket is meant to hang over outer arm of sofa while Arm Wrap end folds over inner sofa arm and tucks down or is wrapped under sofa cushion to hold it firmly in place.
POCKET
Ch 36.
1st row: (RS) 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 35 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 8" [20.5 cm] ending on a WS row. Turn.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
PM at end of last row.
Cont with Arm Wrap as follows:
ARM WRAP
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from marker measures 33" [84 cm].
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Forming and Sectioning Pocket: With WS facing, fold Pocket along marked row to form 8" [20.5 cm] deep pocket (as shown in diagram). Note: WS of Arm Wrap and RS of Pocket is now facing. Join yarn with sl st to folded edge of pocket 5½" [14 cm] from left edge. Keeping yarn at back work and working through both thicknesses, sl st into each row to create a straight vertical chain of sl sts to upper edge of Pocket, taking care to avoid buckling work as you stitch. Fasten off.
Edging and Joining Pocket: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to bottom right corner st of Caddy. Ch 1. Work sc evenly around 3 sides of Caddy, having 3 sc in each of top 2 corners, and working through both thicknesses along side edges of Pocket to join. Do not fasten off. Turn to work across folded bottom edge and cont with Fringe Trim as follows:
Fringe Trim: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Work 37 sc evenly across folded bottom edge of Pocket working around ends of Edging row and working 1 sc in each rem loop (35 loops) along marked row (bottom edge of Pocket). Turn. 37 sc.
2nd row: Ch 6. Skip first 3 sc. Sl st in next sc. *Ch 6. Skip next 2 sc. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. 1 tr in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: *Ch 6. Sl st in next ch-6 sp. Rep from * to last ch-6 sp. Turn.
4th row: Ch 6. Sl st in first ch-6 sp. *Ch 6. Sl st in next ch-6 sp. Rep from * to last ch-6 sp. Ch 6. Sl st in top of tr 2 rows below (2nd row).
Fasten off.
Fringe: Cut strands of yarn 12" [30.5 cm] long. Taking 3 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe in every ch-6 sp from last row. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Aunt Lydia™ Fashion 3 (150 yds/137 m)
Contrast A Purple (182.0531) 1 ball
Contrast B Silver (182.0435) 1 ball
Contrast C Stone (182.0630) 1 ball
Small Hook: Size U.S. F [3.75 mm] crochet hook
Medium Hook: Size U.S. G [4 mm] crochet hook
Large Hook: Size U.S. H [5 mm] crochet hook, or size needed to obtain gauges.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Long sc = Single crochet in stitch 2 rows below
measurements: Case: Approx 6½” x 16½” [16.5 x 42 cm], unfolded and excluding tie. Hook Pouch: Approx 2” x 5” [5 x 12.5 cm]. Handle Holder: Approx 1” x 2” [2.5 x 5 cm]. Cutter Pouch: Approx 1¼” x 1½” [3 x 4 cm]. Yarn Needle Pouch: Approx 1” x 2” [2.5 x 5 cm].
gauge: 25 sc and 27 rows = 4” [10 cm] with U.S. F/5 [3.75 mm] crochet hook. 20 sc and 22 rows = 4” [10 cm] with U.S. G/6 [4 mm] crochet hook.
instructions:
Main Piece 
With U.S. G/6 [4 mm] crochet hook and 2 strands each of B and C, chain (ch) 71.
1st row: [Right side. (RS)].1 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 70 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Repeat (Rep) last row 32 times more. Fasten oﬀ.
Hook Pouch (Make 1) 
With U.S. F/5 [3.75 mm] crochet hook and A, ch 31.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 30 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row 11 times more. Fasten oﬀ.
Handle Holder (Make 2) 
With U.S. F/5 [3.75 mm] crochet hook and A, ch 11.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 10 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row 5 times more. Fasten oﬀ.
Cutter Pouch (Make 1) 
With U.S. F/5 [3.75 mm] crochet hook and A, ch 9.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row 8 times more. Fasten oﬀ.
Yarn Needle Pouch (Make 1) 
With U.S. F/5 [3.75 mm] crochet hook and A, ch 7.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 6 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row 12 times more. Fasten oﬀ.
Border around Main Piece 
With U.S. F/5 [3.75 mm] crochet hook join A with sl st to any corner of Main piece.
1st round (rnd): Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *(Work 2 sc. 1 long sc. 1 sc) spaced evenly. Rep from * around, working 2 sc in corners. Join with slip stitch (sl st) to first sc. Fasten oﬀ. 
Tie 
With U.S. H/8 [5 mm] crochet hook and 3 strands each of A, B and C, ch 50. Join with sl st to middle of right edge of Main Piece. Following Diagram, sew on all pieces.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 ball 672 Spring Green.
Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-7]
Yarn needle.
measurements: Pencil Case is 7” wide x 9½” long.
gauge: 15 sc = 4”; 16 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Ch 26.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 25 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc – 25 sc.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 4½” from beginning, end with a right side row.
Bottom Fold Row (Wrong Side): Ch 1, work sc in each st 2 rows below – 25 sc. 
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 14” from beginning, end with a right side row.
Top Fold Row (Wrong Side): Repeat Bottom Fold Row.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 15½” from beginning. Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Fold top and bottom edges to wrong side along Fold Rows. Working though both layers, sc evenly along edges of each row to secure pockets. 
With right side facing, slip st down center of Pencil Case, working through both layers to divide into two Pockets.
Ties (make 2)
Ch 31. 
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each st across. 
Fasten off. 
Place ties 1” from top and 1” from bottom. Sew to case at center point. Weave in ends.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Classic Crochet size 10: 1 ball 001 White
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 1.5mm [US 7]
Ball® Smooth 7” (17.8 cm) high jar
clear drying house-hold glue
AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10, Art. 154 available in white & ecru 400 yd (365 m); solid color 350 yd (320 m); shaded color 300 yd (274 m) balls
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions given in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Doily measures 5 X 5” (25.4 x 25.4 cm)
instructions:
Ch 7; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 2, beg cl, ch 4, [cl, ch 4] 5 times; join with a slip st to top of beg cl.
Round 2: Slip st in first 2 ch of ch-4, slip st into ch-space, ch 3, 2 dc in same space, ch 4, [3 dc in next ch-4 space, ch 4] 5 times; join to top of ch-3.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in same ch as joining, * dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, ch 2, sc in ch-4 space, ch 2 **, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in same ch as joining, * dc in next 3 dc, 2 dc in next dc, ch 4 **, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in same ch as joining, * dc in next 5 dc, 2 dc in next dc, ch 2, sc in ch-4 space, ch 2 **, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Round 6: Ch 3, dc in next 3 dc, * (dc, ch 4, dc) all in next dc, dc in next 4 dc, ch 4 **, dc in next 4 dc; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Round 7: Ch 3, dc in next 4 dc, * ch 4, sc in next ch-4 space, ch 4, dc in next 5 dc, ch 2, sc in next ch-4 space, ch 2 **, dc in next 5 dc; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Round 8: Ch 2, beg 5-dc-cl, * [ch 5, sc in next ch-4 loop] twice, ch 5, 5-dc-cl, ch 7 **; 5-dc-cl; repeat from * around, end at **; join to top of first cl.
Round 9: Ch 1, (3 sc, picot, 3 sc) all in ch-5 loop, * [(3 sc, picot, 3 sc) all in next loop] twice, (4 sc, picot, 4 sc) all in next ch-7 loop **, (3 sc, picot, 3 sc) all in next ch-5 loop; repeat from * around, end at **; join to first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
FINISHING
Lay the Doily flat (Right Side down) and evenly rub with glue. Place on the center of the jar. Allow to dry completely before moving.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball each 9518 Teal A, 9522 Leaf B, and 9870 Deep Sea C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle, locking stitch markers or seaming pins, 4½” (11.5 cm) of ¾” (2 cm) wide sew-on Velcro®, sewing needle and matching thread
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Bag measures 14” wide x 13” long (35.5 x 33 cm) with flaps folded over.
gauge: 16 sts = 4” (10 cm); 16 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet.
instructions:
Panel #2
With B, ch 53.
Row 1: Hdc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across, turn—52 hdc.
Row 2: Ch 1, hdc in each hdc across, turn.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 9½” (24 cm). Fasten off.

Panel #3
With C, ch 53.
Row 1: Dc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first dc) and each ch across, turn—52 dc.
Row 2: Ch 1, dc in each dc across, turn.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 12” (30.5 cm) ending on wrong side row.
Do not fasten off.

Note: The three flaps that follow are added to the top edge of Panel #3.

Flap #1
Row 1: Ch 1, dc in first 8 dc; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—8 dc.
Rows 2–6: Ch 1, dc in each dc across, turn. Fasten off.

Flap #2
With right side facing, skip next 14 dc from last flap and join C with slip st in next st.
Row 1: Ch 1, dc in same st as join, dc in next 7 dc; leave remaining sts unworked, turn.
Rows 2–6: Ch 1, dc in each dc across, turn. Fasten off.

Flap #3
With right side facing, skip next 14 dc from last flap and join C with slip st in next st.
Row 1: Ch 1, dc in same st as join, dc in last 7 dc, turn.
Rows 2–6: Ch 1, dc in each dc across, turn. Fasten off.

Bag measures 14” wide x 13” long (35.5 x 33 cm) with flaps folded over.

Special Stitch
sc2tog = [Insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.

Special Technique
Join with sc = Place a slip knot on hook, insert hook in indicated stitch, yarn over and draw up a loop, yarn over and draw through both loops on hook.

Notes
1. Bag is made in panels worked back and forth in rows and joined together to form pockets.
2. Backstitching vertically across rows creates pockets of varying sizes.
3. Velcro® fasteners are sewn to flaps to secure bag around the bar of a walker.
4. At the beginning of each row on Panels 2 and 3, draw up first chain to height of half double crochet or double crochet stitch. This first chain does not count as a stitch; do not work into this chain at the end of a row. Work first stitch of each row in last stitch of previous row.

BAG
Panel #1
With A, ch 53.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—52 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 6” (15 cm). Fasten off.

FINISHING
Joining Panels
Lay panel #2 on panel #3 with side and lower edges matching. Lay panel #1 on panel #2 in same manner. Hold panels together with locking stitch markers or seaming pins.

Round 1 (right side): With right side of first row facing, insert hook through all thicknesses and join A with sc in opposite side of last foundation ch; working across ends of rows and through all thicknesses, sc 22 sts evenly across panel #1, sc 10 sts evenly across panel #2, sc 12 sts evenly across panel #3 to first row of flap #1, *sc 9 sts evenly across ends of rows of first side of flap, 3 sc in first st, sc in next 6 sts, 3 sc in last st, sc 9 sts evenly across ends of rows of other side of flap**, sc2tog over same st as last sc and first st after flap, sc in each st to last st before next flap, sc2tog over last st and end of first row of next flap; beginning in same row as last st made, repeat from * twice ending at **; continuing across ends of rows and through all thicknesses, sc 12 sts evenly across panel #3, sc 10 sts evenly across panel #2, sc 22 sts evenly across panel #1; working in opposite side of foundation ch and through all thicknesses, 3 sc in first ch, sc in each ch across to first sc, 2 sc in same ch as first sc; join with slip st in first sc—262 sc.

Round 2: Slip st in each sc around; join with slip st in first slip st. Fasten off.

Pockets
With right side facing, place stitch markers or seaming pins on 19th and 29th sts from right edge. Place additional markers or pins on same sts across various rows as a sewing guideline.

With A and working through all thicknesses, backstitch over the 19th st of each row from bottom edge to top edge of panel #1. Secure and cut yarn. With B and working through all thicknesses, backstitch over 19th st of each row of panel #2. Secure and cut yarn.
With A and working only through panels #1 and #2, backstitch over 29th stitch of each row of panel #1. Secure and cut yarn.

Flaps
Cut three 1½” (4 cm) lengths of Velcro®. With sewing needle and thread, sew Velcro to wrong side of flaps and top of panel, leaving sufficient room to wrap around the bar of a walker.

Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Perfect Phasing™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Deep Teal (43005) 1 ball or 205 yds/188 m
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
Susan Bates® split-lock stitch count marker.
measurements: Approx 8¾" x 33¼" [22 x 84.5 cm], excluding fringe.
gauge: 10 sc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note:
• Caddy is worked with tighter gauge than standard gauge for stability.
• Caddy is worked flat in one piece and folded and seamed to form Pocket.
• Pocket is meant to hang over outer arm of sofa while Arm Wrap end folds over inner sofa arm and tucks down under sofa cushion to hold in place.
• Beg working from lightest end of yarn at Arm Wrap.

ARM WRAP
Ch 21.
See diagram on page 2.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 20 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 33" [84 cm] ending on a WS row. Turn.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only,1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
PM at end of last row.
Cont with Pocket as follows:

POCKET
