Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from marker measures 8" [20.5 cm].
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Edging and Joining Pocket: 
With WS facing, fold Pocket along marked row to form 8" [20.5 cm] deep pocket (as shown in diagram).  Note: WS of Pocket will face RS of Arm Wrap. With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to bottom right corner st of Caddy (at folded row). Ch 1. Work sc evenly around 3 sides of Caddy, having 3 sc in each of top 2 corners, and working through both thicknesses along side edges of Pocket to join. Do not fasten off. Turn to work across folded bottom edge and cont with Fringe Trim (using darker shade of yarn) as follows:

Fringe Trim: 1st row:  (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc around post of last sc of Edging. 1 sc in each of 20 rem loops of marked row. 1 sc around post of first sc of Edging. Turn. 22 sc.
2nd row:  Ch 6 (counts as tr and ch 2). Skip first 3 sc. Sl st in next sc. *Ch 6. Skip next 2 sc. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. 1 tr in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 6. Sl st in each ch-6 sp to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 6. Sl st in each ch-6 sp to end of row. Ch 6. Sl st in top of tr 2 rows below (2nd row). Fasten off.

Fringe:  Cut strands of yarn 12" [30.5 cm] long. Taking 3 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe in every ch-6 sp from last row. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Hot Orange (01628) 1 ball or 120 yds/109 m
Contrast B Warm Brown (01130) 1 ball or 1 yd/1 m
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Scbl = Single crochet in back loops only
measurements: Approx 4½" [11.5 cm] tall, excluding Stem x 5½" [14 cm] in diameter at widest point.
gauge: 10 hdc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] holding 2 strands tog.
instructions:
Note: Join at end of each rnd with sl st to top of first st.
BASKET
**Holding 2 strands of A tog, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 9 hdc in ring. Join. 9 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 18 hdc.**
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 36 hdc.
4th to 9th rnds: Ch 1. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts.
11th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. Fasten off.

LID
Work from ** to ** as given for Basket.
3rd rnd:  Ch 1. 2 hdc in 1st hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 2 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Join. 24 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
5th rnd:  Ch 1. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc last hdc. Join. 36 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
Fasten off.

STEM
With 2 strands of B, ch 7.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 6 sc.
2nd to 4th rows:  Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Do not fasten off.
Fold piece to align rem loops of foundation ch with sts of last row worked.
Joining row:  Working through back loops of sc just worked and rem loops of foundation ch,  sl st in each st to join. Fasten off leaving a long tail.
Using long tail, sew Stem into position at center of Lid.

pattern_name: Crochet Graduation Cap Mason Jar Topper
materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Main Color (MC) Black (00002) 1 ball or 49 yds/45 m
Contrast A Yellow (00010) 1 ball or 10 yds/9 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
4" [10 cm] wide piece of cardboard for tassels.
4" [10 cm] square piece of black cardboard for filling (optional).
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) indicated spaces. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: To fit 500 ml regular mouth Mason jar with 2¾" [7 cm] diameter opening.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
With MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 4 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 3 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 sc in first st. [1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next st] 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in joining sl st. Join with sl st in ch-2 sp. 16 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 1 sc in first ch-2 sp. [1 sc in each of next 4 sc. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp] 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 sc in joining sl st. Join with sl st in ch-2 sp. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. 1 sc in first ch-2 sp. [1 sc in each of next 6 sc. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp] 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 1 sc in joining sl st. Join with sl st in ch-2 sp. 32 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. 1 sc in first ch-2 sp. [1 sc in each of next 8 sc. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp] 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 1 sc in joining sl st. Join with sl st in ch-2 sp. 40 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. 1 sc in first ch-2 sp. [1 sc in each of next 10 sc. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp] 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. 1 sc in joining sl st. Join with sl st in ch-2 sp. 48 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 2. 1 sc in first ch-2 sp. [1 sc in each of next 12 sc. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp] 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. 1 sc in joining sl st. Join with sl st in ch-2 sp. 56 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 2. 1 sc in first ch-2 sp. [1 sc in each of next 14 sc. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp] 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. 1 sc in joining sl st. Join with sl st in ch-2 sp. 64 sc.
10th rnd: Working in back loops only, (sl st in next sc) twice. Ch 1. 1 sc in same st as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. (Sc2tog, skipping ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc) 3 times. Sc2tog in next sc and first sl st. Join with sl st to first sc. 60 sc.
11th rnd: Working in both loops, sl st in next st. Ch 1. 1 sc in same st as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. (Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc) 3 times. Sc3tog in next 2 sc and sl st join. Join with sl st to first sc. 52 sc.
12th rnd: Sl st in next st. Ch 1. 1 sc in same st as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. (Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc) 3 times. Sc3tog in next 2 sc and sl st join. Join with sl st to first sc. 44 sc.
13th rnd: Sl st in next st. Ch 1. 1 sc in same st as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. (Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc) 3 times. Sc3tog in next 2 sc and sl st join. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
14th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc) 3 times. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
15th rnd: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
16th rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd once more. Fasten off.
Tassel
Wrap A around 4" [10 cm] piece of cardboard 25 times. Tie securely at one end with 16" [40.5 cm] length of yarn. Cut across other end. Wrap yarn 6 times around Tassel ¾" [2 cm] from tied end. Fasten securely. Attach tassel to top of Cap as shown in photo.
Optional: Stuff square cardboard into Cap.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Main Color (MC) Hot Green (01712) 1 ball
Contrast A White (00001) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
4 stitch markers.
7" [18 cm] zipper.
Small amount of black embroidery floss for embroidery.
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 12½" [32 cm] long x 5" [12.5 cm] wide.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Alligator Body (make 2)
With MC, ch 2.
1st row: (RS). 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 3 sc.
2nd and alt rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 5 sc.
5th and 7th rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 9 sc at end of 7th row.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 10 sc.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 4 times more. 14 sc at end of last row. Place marker at beg of last row.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from marker measures 4" [10 cm], ending on a WS row.
Shape Head:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 3 sc. Sc3tog. Turn. 12 sts. Place marker at end of row.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 11 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 10 sts.
4th row: As 2nd row. 9 sts.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from 2nd marked row measures 3" [7.5 cm], ending on a RS row.
Next row: (WS). Skip first sc. 6 dc in next sc. Sl st in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Fasten off.
‘Scales’: With RS facing, join MC with sl st to top of Head at marker.
1st row: Ch 1. Work 29 sc evenly along top edge of Alligator to approx 2" [5 cm] from end of tail. Turn.
2nd row: Skip first sc. *3 hdc in next sc. Sl st in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off.
Rep for other side.
Eyes (make 2)
With A, ch 3.
1st rnd: 8 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off.
With black embroidery floss, embroider pupil as shown in photo.
FINISHING
With WS tog, join MC with sl st to Tail where ‘Scales’ end (2" [5 cm] from end of Tail). Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 row of sc to join pieces along bottom of Alligator, around snout to top of Head at marked row.
Fasten off.
With black embroidery floss, embroider mouth using straight st, being careful to not sew through both thicknesses. With A, embroider teeth.
Sew in zipper along top opening.
Feet (make 2)
With MC, ch 6.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd and 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn. Fasten off.
Sew Feet to bottom of Body as shown in picture.

materials: Patons® Grace™ (1.75 oz/50 g; 136 yds/125 m) Main Color (MC) Aquifer (62205) 2 balls
Contrast A Snow (62005) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
2 stitch markers.
Four 15mm buttons.
Coats® All-Purpose™ sewing thread.
Tapestry needle.
Sewing needle.
abbreviations: Fdc (Foundation double crochet) = Ch 3 (counts as first st). Yoh. Insert hook in 3rd ch from hook and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through one loop on hook (ch made). (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice (1 dc made). *Yoh. Insert hook into ch stitch and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through one loop on hook (ch made). (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice (1 dc made). Rep from * for as many fdc as called for in pattern.

Fhdc (Foundation half double crochet) = Ch 2. Yoh. Insert hook in 2nd ch from hook. Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw up through on loop on hook (ch made.) Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook. 1 hdc made. *Yoh. Insert hook into ch st and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through one loop on hook (ch made). Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook (1 hdc made). Rep from * for as many fhdc as called for in pattern.
measurements: Approx 10 ½” [26.5 cm] wide x 8 ¼” [21 cm] tall.
gauge: 18 dc and 10 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.
1st row: (RS). With MC, work 45 fdc. Turn. 45 dc.
2nd row: Ch 3.  1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd to 20th rows: As 2nd row.
21st row: Ch 3.  Working in back loops only, 1 dc in each st to end of row. Turn. PM in first and last st of this row.
22nd and 23rd rows: As 2nd row.
Break MC. Join A.
24th to 26th  rows:  With A, rep 2nd row. Turn. Break A. Join MC.
27th to 29th row:  With MC, rep 2nd row. Turn. Break MC. Join A.
30th to 32nd row: With A, rep 2nd row. Turn.
33rd row: Ch 1. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Fold at 21st row (marked row), with RS facing out. Turn to work through the sides of the rows, and with MC work 1 row of sc through both layers to fold. Ch 2. Sl st across unused loops of 21st row. Ch 2. Sc through both layers to the top of the pocket. Fasten off.
Pockets
Backstitch or surface crochet through both layers of the pocket to divide as desired.
Button Loops (make 2)
1st rnd: Work 23 fhdc. Do not turn. 2 hdc in bottom of last st. 1 hdc in bottom of each rem st to last st. 2 hdc in bottom of last st. Join with sl st. Sew a button on each end.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 254 Pumpkin A and 312 Black B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5 mm [US H-8] and 3.75 mm [US F-5]
Yarn needle
Stitch marker
Three 16 oz (545 g) wide-mouth mason jars
One black ½” (1 cm) button
Black sewing thread and sewing needle
Small pieces of black felt
Sharp fabric scissors
Craft glue (optional)
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Cozies measure 9” (23 cm) around and 4” (10 cm) in height.
gauge: 22 sc = 4” (10 cm); 24 sc rows = 4” (10 cm) with smaller hook.
instructions:
BASIC JAR COZY
With A and smaller hook, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1: 6 sc in adjustable ring, do not join this round or any round of Cozy. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: 2 sc in each st around – 12 sts.
Round 3: * Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 18 sts.
Round 4: * Sc in each of next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 24 sts.
Round 5: * Sc in each of next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 30 sts.
Round 6: * Sc in each of next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 36 sts.
Round 7: * Sc in each of next 5 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 42 sts.
Round 8: * Sc in each of next 6 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 48 sts.
Round 9: * Sc in each of next 11 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 52 sts.
Round 10: Sc in back loop only of each stitch around.
Rounds 11-15: Sc in each st around.
Round 16: * Sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc in each of next 24 sts; repeat from * once more – 50 sts.
Rounds 17- 33: Sc in each st around.
Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

PIRATE VERSION
Pirate Hat Ribbed Band
With B and smaller hook, ch 4.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each of next 2 ch, turn – 3 sc.
Rows 2-35: Ch 1, working in back loops, sc in each st across, turn.
Join last row to first row by working a row of sc through both layers.
Pirate Hat Body
Begin working in rounds as follows:
Round 1: Ch 1, working into row ends of Ribbed Band, work 44 sc evenly spaced around, join with slip st in first sc.
Change to A and larger hook.
Note: For remainder of hat, work all sts in back loops only.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in each st around, join with slip st in first sc.
Change to B; continue using larger hook for remainder of hat.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in each st around, join with slip st in first sc.
Round 4-11: Repeat rounds 2 and 3, alternating colors.
Change to A.
Round 12: Ch 1, sc2tog over first 2 sts, [sc in each of next 8 sts, sc2tog over next 2 sts] 4 times, sc in each of last 2 sts, join with slip st in first sc2tog – 39 sts.
Change to B.
Round 13: Ch 1, sc in each st around, join with slip st in first sc.
Change to A.
Round 14: Ch 1, sc2tog over first 2 sts, [sc in each of next 7 sts, sc2tog over next 2 sts] 4 times, sc in last st, join with sc in first sc2tog – 34 sts.
Change to B.
Round 15: Repeat Round 13.
Change to A.
Round 16: Ch 1, [sc in next st, sc2tog over next 2 sts] 11 times, sc in last st, join with slip st in first sc – 23 sts.
Change to B.
Round 17: Repeat Round 13.
Change to A.
Round 18: Ch 1, sc in first st, [sc2tog over next 2 sts] 11 times, join with slip st in first sc – 12 sts.
Change to B; fasten off A.
Round 19: Ch 1, [sc2tog over next 2 sts] 6 times, join with slip st in first sc2tog – 6 sts.
Fasten off.
Weave yarn tail through top opening to close hole.
Weave in ends.
Pirate Eye Patch
With B and smaller hook, ch 7.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd st from hook and in each st across, turn – 6 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in each next 3 sts, sc2tog over last 2 sts, turn – 4 sts.
Fasten off.
Eye Patch Ties
With B and smaller hook, ch 7, slip st across top row of Eye Patch just made, ch 7.
Fasten off.
Weave in ends.
Finishing
Referring to the photo for placement and using sewing needle and thread, sew button to Cozy for eye. Sew Eye Patch to Cozy in the same manner, curving the ties upward so their ends are level with top edge of Cozy.

SKELETON VERSION
Skeleton Eyes (make 2)
With B and smaller hook, ch 3.
Round 1: 3 hdc in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, rotate piece 180 degrees so that you are working into unused loops at bottom of foundation ch, 3 hdc in each of next 2 ch, join with slip st in first hdc – 12 hdc.
Fasten off.
Weave in ends.
Skeleton Nose
Ch 2, 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Fasten off.
Weave in ends.
Finishing
Referring to the photo for placement and using sewing needle and thread, sew Eyes and Nose to Cozy. Embroider mouth using single strand of B and yarn needle and working in short straight sts. Secure and trim ends.

JACK-O-LANTERN VERSION
Using template found at end of pattern, cut out felt shapes using sharp fabric scissors.
Finishing
Place Cozy over jar. Referring to the photo for placement, pin features securely to cozy. Remove jar and sew features on using sewing needle and thread.
